38970887.review:
I don't really write reviews that often, but I felt compelled to write about this game. I could not put this game down until I finished all the content. OMG, this game is amazing. From the feel of the game to the mechanics to the voice scripting and the sarcasm, I must give this VR experience TOP MARKS!!!!. This was well worth my money and time. You can tell the desginers took their time working out every detail and making sure that the VR experience was smooth and flexible. I love the pick up system behind objects, the physics were spot on to blending with reality and the sound effects were timed correctly and realtisically.

The storyline was unique in itself but mirrored any 1960s-1970's spy movies or books in it's art and systems, yet with an updated technology bits, think about the Show "Archer", that should give you an idea of what the game looks and feels like. The theme music was amazing and I'm listneing to that on repeat while I write this review....and matched with the VR opening credits full immersion, that was great!!! I was already loving the game before I had any direct interactions!!!!

Now lets get down to the puzzles. Of course this follows the pathway of other puzzle games in that you have to find hidden objects through clever interaction of the environment through different problem solving and clues that you find. Not all of which is immediate intuative and require mutliple and diverging lines of thought to come to the solutions. But this game does it in very unique ways and slowly builds you up with its unique system, so much you don't really notice aside from the increased level of challenges with each new mission.

I don't have any real complaints for this game and will be keeping a close eye on this company for new releases and hopefully part 2 of this game. I could easily see many more episodes of this spy game and many spinoffs from it. This was so much fun, thank you to everyone involved in this game. Easily one of the best VR games I've ever played and so far the best VR game I've played on steam to date.

38955212.review:
Beautifully executed down to the last! Played this on Rift+Touch and was greatly impressed, very natural interactions throughout, great puzzles, lovely visual style, telekenesis was a nice touch to smooth playability, and the intro had me giggling like a small child waiting for Christmas - Schell Games really did their homework, this is clearly a passionately made game with great production values, and that is further borne out by the developer commentary that is available once you complete the game, sounds like they had a great time making it.

I paid ten quid, completed in a touch under 3hrs - short but perfectly formed, totally worth it at that price, and I'll get more play time out of this with friends for sure and chasing the extra objectives.

Thanks to all those responsible for making the game, I thoroughly enjoyed it - and as a bonus it bought back some fond memories of No One Lives Forever, which I loved to bits back in the day - who doesn't love retro 60's spy chiq silliness :)

Short but sweet game.

In this game you take the roll of a detective. Not any ordinary detective. But one with the abillity to use telekinesis to get the job done. The controls are a bit messy at first but they're easy to master. The game is meant to be played from a sitting position, I recommend an office chair you can swivel to see things. The puzzles require you to look around the environment to solve. Once a puzzle is solved you can go onto the next for a total of 5 missions (as of time of writing). There are collectibles to find as you play that will go into your office. Additionally you can mess around with things in the level. Like smoking a cigar, drinking, putting on a hat, putting a lid on your head, eating, or you can just set everything in your possession on fire.

Overall it's a great game, a low violence game good for a set through, and pretty good for parties.

38747037.review: This is a lovely spy themed VR game. In its current phase, the game contains 5 separate missions, all of which are played while seated (which is surprisingly relaxing after standing and walking around for hours in other VR games). Each mission contains completely different gameplay, so no "look at your surroundings and keep doing the same thing over and over" like in Job Simulator, for instance. You'll die a lot especially in the first few missions before you get the hang of it. :) Each mission also contains a speedrun challenge and 5 other secret challenges to be done, which increases the replay value a bit. I finished the game with all achievements in 3.2 hours. 23€ might be a bit too much for a 3 hours long game, but for 50 % off that I bought it for, I am perfectly satisfied and can heartily recommend it.

38651276.review:
This experience was one of the best I've had in VR. It's got a very classic spy theme that channels James Bond-esque themes. The into even seems to be a homage to the Bond movie intros.

It's a seated experience that provides you with telekinetic powers to grab distant objects and manipulate things far away from you. The mechanics felt pretty well designed, I rarely felt like my failures were the game poorly explaining something or having clunky controls.

The puzzles were clever and very well presented in the classic spy theme.

The sound and art design were perfect for the experience.

While the game may not be very long or have high replay value I think you'll be presently surprised by the quality of the puzzles this game presents. I would absolutely recommend this experience to VR veterans and newcomers alike. You will have plenty of wonderful VR moments where you toss an object back and forth in your hands, pondering your way out of a sticky situation, only to catch the answer out of the corner of your eye. Very satisfying.

I look forward to seeing what else Schell Games can achieve in the future and hope they create a sequel to this wonderful game.

38546784.review:
Caught this on sale - not a bad title.

Obviously the game is entirely spoofing our favorite 00 spy and the intro video in the game is rather well done and gives you the feeling that you've stepped into a Bond movie.

Onto the game proper...  The presentation & art style is along the lines of a retro sixties spy film, with a bit of cheese on the side and it works well for this type of game.  Everything looks surprisingly crisp and it runs pretty smooth for me.

I like the fact that the control scheme includes telekinetic abilities - I don't know how many times I've dropped an item in other VR games, but then can't pick them up off of the floor because the scale is wrong - this avoids that, as you can bring any interactable object right into your hand.  I wish all games allowed this.  Now I only wish someone would make a Bioshock VR...

The gameplay is fairly straightforward.  Use the clues given by the narrator and in the environment to figure out how to complete the objectives.  I've only done two missions - died twice on the first one, but completed the second one with no  issues.  Will see how the rest plays out, but so far I like it.

Will update this again later, but so far I think that many of the reviews were right about this being a bit overpriced, so catch it on sale if you can.

38541075.review: So far one of my favorite VR games. Well worth the money. A game that makes you think with a flow system.

38517522.review:
I Expect You to Die provides the player with a seated VR escape room experience with a spy movie theme. In each episode, you use your telekenetic powers to manipulate objects in the environment around you to escape each deadly predicament and foil the plans of an evil megalomaniac.

While you don’t have the same level of mobility you would in other escape room games, being seated never becomes an issue and this game looks and plays better than any other VR escape game I’ve played to date (e.g. it feels more like a full game than a tech demo). Worth the buy!

38514677.review:
I loved!! this game. It feels like an escape room with a James Bond theme and plays very well. And the intro. The intro absolutely floored me. I sat back in my chair with my mouth open in awe. I can see this being the future of movies and I look forward to it. As with any VR game, it's pretty expensive for a short length but I think it's worth the sale price. I loved each level (except the First Class one) and the puzzles were entertaining and engaging.

A few minor nitpicks
[list]
    [*]A few of the levels feel like they could have benefited from utilizing room scale. The antivirus level specifically, I tricked my camera so I could actually walk around inside the lab.
    [*]I'm not the biggest fan of the controls. They work after you get used to them, but I would have preferred an option to toggled grab. The controls were also imprecise at times and I would drop objects.
    [*]The game does not accurately know where the ground is, and I would often find myself reaching down to grab something only to hit my floor.
    [*]I really disliked the First Class update mission. I couldn't figure out a lot of things and the game kept skipping an entire chunk of dialogue from your handler, making the mission really confusing. It's also a bit lengthier than the others and restarting was incredibly annoying. It got to the pint where I could do the majority of the mission before the first piece of dialogue finished, so it could really use a checkpoint.
[/list]

I think overall it's a great game, and I hope to see more levels in the future.

James Bond was a literary creation worthy of genius status, this James Bond themed VR puzzle / escape game doesn't quite reach that pinnacle but that's not to say it isn't good, on the contrary it is very good indeed.  

Packed full of British comedy gold and just challenging enough to make you think outside of the box, or perhaps even under the box! ;-)

The game is also big enough in VR to justify Room-Scale but has a telekinesis feature implemented which allows you to remain stationary and pull objects to your hand.  This allows for a big play space in-game even if you have a small play space at home.

The challenges are pretty straight forward, you will fail but you will learn with each failure and progress closer to completion each time that you do.

The depth of this game is in question, there simply is not enough content here to justify £20...a recent update has increased content but for this price tag more needs to be included.  I expect to see DLC's for this game and that could and indeed should force the price of the main game down to a more respectful level.  I for one would like to buy 5 levels for £3-5 depending on quality and complexity and if good enough then I would continue to do so.

Fun game for the whole family and as easy as it is comical.

38240637.review:
I Expect You To Die is a fantastic VR puzzle game. Become the secret agent you always knew you were.... and let the shenanigans begin! 

TLDNR: +Game Mechanics, Graphics, Humor :: - No Room Scale, Too Short
VERDICT: 10/10 Shenanigans, Buy It!

If you own VR, I Expect You To Die should be on everyone's list.

VISUALS: The visuals are fantastic. Schell Games did a great job. The environments are clean and has a 70s retro feel to them. And oh man that opening intro…. amazing work.

GAME PLAY: The gameplay mechanics really stand out in this game. The controls are simple and everything just works. The game is made to be played while sitting down but gives you the ability to pick up and control things from a distance. It works great and the transition from in your hand to using something remotely is very smooth.It's very intuitive and easy to use. I would love to see this made for room scale. You can solve the puzzles in various ways and laughs are sure to follow as you attempt to complete them.

STORY: The story is fairly simple. You are a secret agent trying to stop Zoraxis, a nefarious global weapons and pharmaceutical corporation.  You are sent on various missions in hope that you will finally get that vacation you’ve been waiting for. Solve the puzzles or die trying! I enjoyed the story and gameplay so much I just wish it was longer! The studio did release a new mission … I mean… vacation… level for you to play. Its nice to see the game updated. 

REPLAY VALUE: I really wish the game were longer as it is so much fun! Even taking your time you can play through the missions in 2 or 3 hours. There is some replayability as you can complete the missions in various ways. There are also achievements for all you hunters out there. This will become one of my go-to games when I demo the HTC Vive. It is also available on other VR platforms.

CONCLUSION: If you own VR, this game is a solid buy! You will not be disappointed.

I stream live on Twitch. Drop by and say hello sometime!

https://twitch.tv/sirselrahc

38149691.review:
凄腕のスパイになれるVRシミュレーター
どんだけ凄腕かというと、頭の中にテレキネシスが使えるチップを埋め込んでいるので、手が届かないくらい遠いところの物体も簡単に掴むことができます。また、凄腕なので掴んだ物体を手元に引き寄せたり、逆に手元から遠くに運んだり、なんなら空中に固定することだってできます（凄腕スパイの特徴）
ーーーーーーーーーーー以下ゲーム性に関してーーーーーーーーーーーーー
そんな凄腕スパイですが、ひとつだけ欠点があります。
事前の用意があまりにガバガバで、しかも凄腕ゆえに敵も多いため、
毎回様々な妨害やアクシデントに見舞われるのです。
この妨害やアクシデントへの対処を楽しむのがゲームの根幹ですので、アクシデントの内容についてはここでは言及しません。
また、PVを見てると「次々と襲い掛かる困難を乗り越えよ」というようなイメージを受けますが、実際のところスパイが何か行動を起こさない限り状況は（基本的に）動きません。
行動AをするとアクシデントBが発生、Bを無事対処し終えて次の行動Cを行うと、また次のアクシデントDが発生。という感じで、あまりせわしなさを感じることはありませんでした。
このゲームはトライアンドエラーを、別の言い方をすると初見殺しを楽しむゲームだと思います。
０ではありませんが、ランダム性が今のところほとんど感じませんので、１つのミッションをクリアするころにはそのミッションので起こりえるイベントと対処法を覚えてしまって、新鮮味はなくなってしまいました。
しかし視点を変えれば、それもまた凄腕スパイっぽいことでもあります。どんな困難に見舞われようと、涼しい顔して葉巻を咥えつつ、片手でひょいひょい対応出来てしまうのですから。まるで未来が見えているかのように・・・（見えています）

もしクリア直前でミスしてしまい、またミッションの最初からやり直すのかぁ・・・と思ったときは
近年流行りの『死に戻り』のVRシムとして楽しむことをおすすめします。

ミッションごとに隠し要素があり、それを見つけるのも楽しいですね。
スピードランもあるので、死に戻りの成果をクライアントに見せつけてやるのも良いでしょう

ーーーーーーーーーーーーー以下その他に関してーーーーーーーーーーーー
OP映像はとてもcoolです。自分はどことなくキャサリンやペルソナ４・５などの某アト〇スっぽさを感じました。
ちょくちょく挿入される007っぽいアレ（ﾃｯﾃ↑　ﾃﾃｰ↓）もクスリとしてしまいます。


最後に、一番このゲームでおすすめできる点は、『椅子に座ったままのプレイが前提』ということです。
プレイエリアの狭さに嘆くことも、壁との距離を気にかける必要もありません。しかしモニターやデスクからは１歩分くらい下がったほうが良いです。目の前の扉を開けようとしてモニターにパンチを繰り出す恐れがありますので。

ただ、ステージによっては周囲３６０度すべてに何かしらありますので、椅子は回転できるほうが良いでしょう。
そして椅子の肘置きを取り外せるならば、取り外しておくことをおすすめします。


以上！新入りスパイからの報告文書でした！
                                                    Burn After Reading

38019725.review:
Although short (it can be finished it little over an hour) I Expect You To Die is a fun and exciting escape adventure. There are five levels, each of which you have to escape from within a set amount of time. These situations range from an old lush cabin littered with traps straight out of a James Bond movie to a small submarine that is slowly collapsing under immense water pressure. The scenes are all great fun, have a lot of interesting puzzles and challenges and make excellent use of the Touch Controllers (although lazy spies need not worry: the entire game is a seated experience). The dialogue is witty, the music is smooth and sexy and the game almost feels like a zany and colourful spinoff of the excellent spy shooter No One Lives Forever. 

The one problem remains the short play time. Is it worth the price of admission if it can (and most likely will) be finished in two hours tops? I got it on sale and I was happy with my purchase. So I'd recommend you'd do the same.

I expect you to die ist eine Hommage an die guten alten James Bond-Filme.
Gespickt mit reichlich Humor sollen wir verschiedene Missionen für den Geheimdienst übernehmen, bei denen wir erwartungsgemäß (wie der Name schon sagt) sterben werden. Und zwar vermutlich mehr als 1x.
Wir selbst sind Geheimagent mit telekinetischen Fähigkeiten. Gegenstände können wir mit Hilfe unserer Gedanken bewegen. Das funktioniert auch allgemein ganz gut.
Die Missionen selbst erinnern eher an Escape-Room-Spiele. Durch kombinieren und ausprobieren rätseln wir uns durch verschiedene "Räume" und versuchen so die Welt zu retten.
Die Rätsel selbst sind logisch durchdacht und machen einfach spaß.
Das Setting ist stimmig und die Grafik passend. Das Spiel läuft extrem flüssig (GTX 970) und auch Aussetzer oder Abstürze hatte ich keine.
Das Spiel läßt sich komplett im sitzen spielen und benutzt die von der Playstation bekannten 180°, ist Geschmackssache, aber bei dem Spiel empfand ich es nicht als störend.
Mit insgesammt etwas über 2 Stunden (bin selbst noch nicht durch) für den Preis etwas teuer, aber im Sale auf jeden Fall eine Empfehlung.

Gruß Ziffi

This is like playing a version of Groundhog Day meets Johnny English.  You are a pretty inept spy trying to foil the villains plots but getting killed all the time.  Tons of fun but like almost all the VR games out there this one has the typical drawbacks.

Pros:
The intro is so well done you actually sit through it multiple times.
The premise and story is a great idea.
The controls are pretty simple and rather intuitive.
You can play from a seated position because of your "Telekinesis Implants" (which i would like to say is a great way of making the game seated compatible).
Lots of reasons to go back and try for completeness and getting all the items for your office.

Cons:
Again with VR games it is very short.  You can "beat" the game in maybe an hour or two.
Want all the items in the office it will take longer
I (obviously) have the steam version playing it with a Rift so I have to reset my seated position regularly and view but I assume that isn't typical for others and doesn't deter from the enjoyment of the game.
Puzzles can be hard and repetitive with little clues to go on.  You may have to die several times to get the mission right.

Overall this is a must buy for anyone with VR.  It plays great in limited space (My Standing Area is a bit smaller than the recommended size here on steam)  and plays great seated with a few seated position resets now and then.  I do not have floor issues where things drop below the physical floor or anything.  Again if you have VR this is a must purchase.

34226553.review:
A Fantastic VR experience that is played sitting down. You assume the role of a bond-style secret agent who has to solve puzzles under pressure. I won't spoil too much but the gist of the game is you are dropped into an area (like a secret base or special vehicle) and given a simple task. However this simple task requires you to complete several other tasks, often times under the threat of death if you fail, which ramps up into quite a tense and addictive puzzle game. Its got a cartoon art style that is very detailed and works great in VR and the game just oozes charm at every turn. 

One of this game's best features I think is the inclusion of Telekenitc powers. What this basically allows you to do is pick up objects that aren't necessarily within arms reach and move them closer or farther from you. This allows you to grab items from across the room without moving but has the added benefit that if you encounter any controller tracking issues or have a small play space you can use these powers to retrieve the item. For example, if you don't have a large play space you don't have to worry about reaching too far and bumping something, you can just pull it towards you. 

The only downside to this game is the amount of content. Not including the bond-style opening movie and brief tutorial there are only four missions. Each of these missions are unique and can be quite hard to complete but are the same every time. Thus, after you finish them all, you're basically out of stuff to do. Being puzzles have the fun is figuring it out the first time. Once you know the answer its a lot less exciting. It seems to be a common for VR games to lack content. Fortunately  there is new content in the works!

The game is super fun and oozes charm. Don't be fooled by the fact that you play sitting as its not a relaxed ride. With new content on the way, I'd say this is a must buy. If you're worried about replayability then I'd say wait for a sale.

I really enjoyed this game.

Pros:

- All four puzzles are very different.
- Nice prop variety and interactivity
- Solid performance (ran without a single hiccup!)
- Pretty sweet animated intro
- Nice art direction
- Genuinely fun gameplay

Cons:

- Hand models have weird fingers (probably needs more subdivisions on the mesh)
- Super short in length
- Animated intro has some very stiff animation (I'm an animator so this bugs me a little. Won't bother most people)
- Voice acting is distractingly just okay. Not bad, but for a game like this, you'd want it to be very good.
- Expensive price considering this is about as long as one telltale episode. ($25 USD at time of this review)
- Not much replay value (unless you're willing to sit and watch your guests try to figure it out)
- You completely restart from the beginning of the puzzle when you die (clearly to pad out the length)

Basically, if you're in a financial position where you don't care about how much you get for what you pay for, I can completely recommend this wholeheartedly. It's easily in my top 5 favorite games I've played on the Vive so far. It isn't perfect, but it's a real joy regardless. [spoiler]Hope the sequel is longer. Unless that teaser at the end was for DLC.[/spoiler]

(Played with HTC Vive on a computer with a slightly underpowered CPU)

31584350.review:
A good espionage-themed puzzle game that's almost great.

Each level is a series of small puzzles, some can be done in any order and have alternate solutions while others are sequenced checkpoints that require a collection of solutions. The ear piece narrator does a great job of acknowledging when you try a fun combination, even when it doesn't get you closer to the goal. Each level also has a set of special objectives for completionists that hint at wacky combinations you missed.

Many times you're just picking apart a familiar environment where the real world logic applied (in a car you check the glove box, the arm rest, the sun visor, roll down the windows, etc.). But there's just enough Roger-Moore-era spy goofiness to catch you off guard or surprise you with a joke.

While the dialog is pretty clever the delivery is just a tad off, sounds like someone doing an impression of M mixed with Q rather than a genuine curmudgeon Brit. A similar problem for the intro sequence, it looks great and the lyrics are fine, the singer has an excellent voice, but lacks to the pipes to pull off a Shirley Bassey. The game looks and sounds good, but occasionally there's a particle effect or bit of audio that pulls me out of the world. These are all minor complaints, but with a smidge more polish and production this could gone over the top as one of VR's best.

Much respect to the creators and I'm excited to play whatever they do next!

31363213.review:
The Good:

- The intro credit sequence is awesome
- Nails the spy theme
- Missions require a little bit of lateral thinking
- Some parts of the missions have multiple solutions
- Collectibles that encourage you to replay the missions in different ways
- Extensive developer commentary that can be enabled after completing the game
- Game does a good job making use of its mechanics and setting

The Bad:

- Play time is pretty short (~2 hrs) if you're not trying to collect everything
- Most of the puzzles are very easy
- When you die you have to redo the entire mission
- May cause motion sickness for some due to moving sequences in credits/final mission
- Seated experience with "telekinesis" mechanism for interacting with far-away objects (bummer if you prefer room-scale)

The Ugly:

- One puzzle had some hidden items that were a little too cleverly hidden. Spent a decent chunk of playtime trying to figure out the solution, only to end up looking for hints online

---

Overall, the game was a lot of fun to play despite some minor flaws. I can't wait to watch my friends play it. I am definitely going to do a second playthrough to listen to all the developer commentary (that alone makes the game worth it to me).

Really well produced game. Great atmosphere, sound, narration, etc.

31361283.review: I Expect You To Die has been on the Oculus Rift for a while now, but even though I bought it once there I've been waiting forever for it to come to the Vive so that I could play it more with native control support. There are a lot of VR escape rooms out there, but even though IEYTD is intended as a seated game it's still my favorite by far. It takes about 2 to 3 hours to complete it the first time (there are 4 levels), but each mission has a list of hints for bonus objectives you can try to find by playing around with the environments, and there's also a commentary mode unlocked after the end of the game. It has a silly Bond theme that reminds me of No One Lives Forever, and the opening sequence is one of my favorite moments in VR so far. You need this game if you're into escape games at all.

31360217.review: although very short, it is very well done, the graphics are great as is the interaction and comedy. the best room escape ive played in vr. my only complaint was it was too short but it is aesome that it is a fully finished and polished game unlike so many early access ones that they should never have been released.

39608467.review: Wow, what a game! A little short but well worth the £9.49 in the Sale. As has been said in other reviews, the introduction is amazing, worthy of a Bond film. By the end of the game I was nochalantly sitting in the chair, hat on, with cigar in one hand and zippo in the other :D A really well thought out and funny game with nice graphics that works well in the seated VR format. Some clever puzzles, a little infuriating at times but it would have been too easy otherwise. It's going to be one of my VR showcase titles for sure. I hope they produce some more levels soon, maybe a DLC pack or something as would be great to have a load more puzzles. Only other issue is replay value as once you know the solution to the puzzles then that's it really but there are challenges to complete (eg speed run etc) to keep it interesting. In summary, a great game that is a lot of fun!
